title: Africa Sustainable Livestock 2050: Biosafety and Public Health Practices in Poultry Farming in Kenya

tasks.task: Meet Winnie Wangoi, a poultry farmer from Juju in Kiambu County.
subtasks: Approach Winnie Wangoi and introduce oneself.
Learn about Winnie's involvement in the FAO study.
Discuss Winnie's training and certifications received from FAO.
Explore the impact of the FAO training on reducing mortality and increasing slaughter weight.

tasks.task: Participate in the FAO study under the Africa Sustainable Livestock initiative.
subtasks: Attend FAO seminars in Nairobi and Machakos.
Understand the importance of proper practices in poultry farming.
Implement a checklist for biosecurity practices to reduce zoonotic diseases and antimicrobial resistance.
Collaborate with county and national veterinary services.
Monitor poultry health and report any incidents.

tasks.task: Separate clean and dirty areas in the poultry farm.
subtasks: Designate clean and dirty areas on the farm.
Separate feathers and carcasses for proper disposal.
Follow proper handling and processing of poultry.
Train other farmers in the community to improve practices.

tasks.task: Stay updated on poultry farming developments.
subtasks: Attend conferences and workshops on poultry farming.
Utilize available tools and resources for farming.
Address challenges and concerns in the community.
